place_name: The Holy Grind Coffee House of Kannapolis

reviews_data.review_text:
1st time going here 8/24/24. I have always wanted to go but, never could find the time. So, Saturday we went. The Menu is impressive, and we were so excited. We pulled up to the 1st window and waited what felt like forever, with just one car in front of us, no signs saying stay here to order, no one at window. No one ever came to the 1st window, so we pulled up the 2nd window, and then one of the girls came to the window and then asked us to put the truck into reverse to the 1st window.  Yes, she seemed nice but, then you could feel the aggravation with us, and the other girl she was working with, and kept calling her name (that started with an A, to not put her name out there) and then we asked about pastries and she called for the other girl and never helped her and then went and checked she just seemed Very Frustrated.
Put our order in, and I guess to sit at 2nd window again for an extended time. Watching the (2 girls) talk to people at the front counter, and waited what felt like way too long for 2 drinks, and 2 Pastries. Then she shoved the boxed items out the window, and No thank you, No have a Nice day...Nothing. The coffees were OK (5/10), (all the syrup was at the bottom :/ even though you had to try to stir the iced one with the straw that kept bending which I recommend a stronger straw if such thing. Pastries seemed like from "Sams"  tasted good, but everything was Over Priced. We were the only ones in the drive thru for 20+mins. The girl who ever she is could have made this better, but if they don't have enough help, or if the help isn't helping then this is what is going to happen every time.  The Friendly vibe wasn't there and what she tried just felt like attitude when we had questions.

Long Wait time, Not Friendly, Over Priced for Just OK Coffee, and attitude is Not worth it.

First time here and great tasting coffee, really nice atmosphere, and super friendly service. I'm originally a west coast guy (don't hold it against me) and I'm always looking for great tasting coffee. Smooth flavor, just the right amount of boldness, and no after-taste. Well done
The coffee and service we're phenomenal. The way they redid the old Hardee's building, absolutely beautiful, if I didn't know it was a Hardee's at one point I never would have guessed.

A great place to work out of or get inspired.
Great relax vibe.

Like this place . So far so good .
Stood at the deive theough for about 10 minutes to go inside and be told the time it closes.  On google it says 8. Drive through closes at 7pm please change that.  Put a sign up saying it , somthing .
We've tried every coffee place around Kannapolis, and this is by far our favorite.  Great coffee, service, and atmosphere. They're also consistent throughout their locations, which is amazing.
Just moved to the area and I am already in love. This place is amazing. Very helpful and courteous staff. My eight year old and I will definitely be back often.

I just paid $8.90 for this tiny coffee, and then AFTER I paid, she told me they were out of cold foam, which I would assume I paid extra for (as I would hope a medium coffee is not $8.90). I have been here many times and have put off writing a bad review because I love the message but the drinks are always bad. It's always mostly milk- God bless the baristas, but they don't know how to make espresso or coffee drinks. I recommend the coffee shop vibes but I don't recommend the coffee.

UPDATE: Thank you to the owner for offering to remake my drink. I wasn't able to make it back there til last week but I got it remade and it did not disappoint. Wonderful customer service, thank you again, for offering to remake it for me. I will be back

Went today for the first time. I ordered a small cold brew coffee with vanilla and light cream. It was pretty good! It's a bit sweet for me (not the barista's fault). The lady who made it knows what light cream is, which made me happy. I also got a blueberry muffin. There wasn't anything special about it...it was a muffin, lol. I'll definitely be back to try more drinks. The atmosphere is amazing.

I used to love going here. The coffee is very good. Unfortunately, we will not be going back. Went today through the drive thru and ordered my usual large coffee. The price was a $1 more than usual so I asked why it was. The employee said the prices went up and they didn't change them on the drive thru sign. She was not pleasant and seemed mad that I asked. How was I to know when your signs do not reflect accurate prices? False advertisement? So sad but but the customer service ruined my visit.
Love the vibe. Really good coffee. Very friendly staff. Cute murals.
It's a wonderful coffee shop with many other options for non coffee drinkers
Love it!
It's not bad just pricey... $8 for my usual iced vanilla latte where it is $5-$6 everywhere else.
Coffee  and tea drinks are many!!! Not much of a food menu but they are working on it. I had a chicken salad croissant excellent. Awesome atmosphere.
This is an awesome place to gather; the ambiance is impeccable! I don't mind paying extra for superb coffee but they need more staff.
Took 45 mins to get my coffee, and it was ok, but not worth the 5 bucks it cost
The  best place to go for coffee. Wonderful  atmosphere.

This past Wednesday I stopped by for the first time. My son is buying a house down the street! I am a Christian and was excited to see the name and music playing. Business was slow only a few folks sitting around in the wonderful inside area. The time was 10:30am. There were two older gentlemen in front of me, they ordered and I was next. The young lady was nice and took my order. I walked over and sat with the gentleman. About 20 min. went by and no-one got there coffee. I finally walked back up and could not find the worker. She finally came out I I told her I had an appointment and could not wait any longer! Come to find out she was the only worker in the store....handling drive thru and walk-in business! I would ask that if the owner reads this, you need to have  the RIGHT AMOUNT of staff at all times!! I look forward to your response! And yes I have been in the restaurant business for many years! Thank you!... Its Good Friday!
Recommended!!! 99.o sanitation.

I hate leaving a bad review anywhere. But I waited over 25 minutes for a coffee and a muffin and paid close to 14 dollars when I added the prices up of what I got it was 10 dollars not sure what I was charged 4 extra dollars for. My coffee tasted awful.
Have to go back! Was just that nice.
I used the drive thru. The young lady was very helpful. She was kind to give me suggestions and made my request of really hot coffee to my liking. I enjoyed the experience! Good job!!
An all around great place to get coffee, danishes & other pastries. Plus the staff are super friendly!
I ordered iced coffee, they made hot. And it took way too long! Then they poured the hot coffee over ice and gave it to us ! No ice no flavor! Poor service and poor quality

If I could give this place -0 stars, I would. Here's why: I got a call by from The Holy Grind and they wanted to set up an interview since I had sent in an application a few weeks back.
I said sure, but made it a point to ask if being a wheelchair user would be acceptable in that environment.
The man did not put me on mute while he spoke with his wife, and she was nothing but rude in the background.
It took them both a solid 15 minutes in mumbles about how I shouldn't have applied if I use a wheelchair and how if I can't stand for long periods of time, why anyone would hire me.
The woman then came on the phone to speak directly to me and said that they had never been asked about disability before.
She told me that unfortunately I would not even be able to wash their dishes as their sinks are too deep/ tall and I probably wouldn't be able to reach in them.
She also told me that I couldn't even be a front cashier bc she thinks the counters would be too high.
All these assumptions about how incapable I am and how a person "like me" and "with my level of needs" shouldn't be applying for jobs in a physical shop. That I should "stick to remote positions in the future."
They don't even pay their employees well near enough ($9/hr).
But just to hear those things in reference to my disability and them not even seeing me or considering anything else I'm capable of doing?
That hurt. A lot.
They claim to be Christian and "Go by the Lord".... I'm not sure I believe that anymore. For the Lord would've found a way to include me instead of exclude me just because of my wheelchair use.
And to deny someone a job because of a disability is ILLEGAL mind you.
But it's not worth my time nor my energy to get into it with their conceded little minds.
Such a cute little coffee shop! All the employees are so nice and helpful! Definitely a good place to meet up with a friend!
Love this coffee shop!
Good coffee and a staff that are willing to help us out with a little something different to broaden our coffee experience.
Move over Starbucks! Better atmosphere, better coffee AND less expensive? Easiest decision I've made all year!!  !+
Kelsie was great ! Came back for a second drink it was delicious!
An absolute delight on every level every time I stop here.

My first time visiting this location & I waited 50 minutes to receive 2 drinks. No that is not an exaggeration. It was a Saturday night & the young lady appeared to be alone. So while I understand she was busy, there is still absolutely no reason whatsoever anyone should wait almost an hour for beverages. It's not like I was sitting at a restaurant waiting for a full course meal... it was Literally 2 drinks. Other patrons were also getting antsy and frustrated by the ridiculous wait time. People's time is valuable and this is unacceptable.
I meet here every Tuesday with my group.  We love the coffee and the atmosphere.
I love THG! You've got to try their peanut butter pie shake!
An amazing coffee shop to sit, drink good coffee, get work done and relax. The owners are so inviting and all the workers are so sweet. A gem for Cabarrus and Rowan county.
Poor service, unknowledgeable employees, won't be back
I like the coffee but the customer service is the best part!!!
People are friendly here. A little higher priced but still worth stopping by if your going past!

I went for the first time this morning with high expectations, I was extremely disappointed save will not return,  I arrived at 6am at opening, it was the only customer and it took 13 minutes to get my order, I only ordered and iced coffee, nothing else and paid over $3 for a coffee half the size if a McDonalds coffe I'd pay $1 for on the app, im fine with paying more for a premium product but the girl making my coffee simply poured hot coffee over ice and added cream , what I got was extremely watered down and tasted like rust from the dirty looking metal cup yhe worker used to stir it so that the plastic cup didn't mt when she poured hot coffee over ice.  During my 12 minute wait I watched yhe employees clumsily and slowly set up for business setting iut what looked too be days old grocery store bought pastries marked up to fresh bakery prices.  Its a good thing your salvation comes from the grace of God and not your business.  Terrible place, Ill never return . Its ok to be a Christian business, its not ok to use your faith to get business out of your beliefs if your product is poor.

Came to the Holy Grind this morning for the first time. Everyone raves about it. After today I'm not sure why. I ordered an iced caramel macchiato with oat milk and the cheese danish. I spent $10 and I tipped a dollar. When she handed me my drink I noticed that the label said whole milk. So I asked her if it did in fact have whole milk that I wont be able to drink it because it will make me sick. And that I had asked for oat milk. She tells me that the label maker just prints it out that way and that it should be fine. I could tell that it was regular milk. As someone who cannot drink it, you definitely notice it when it's in your presence. I told her that I wasn't comfortable with drinking it because if it is in fact whole milk I will get sick. So if she could just please check to make sure. She takes the drink and is gone for a few minutes. Comes back and says I think I fixed it and everything should be fine now, and tells me again it's just the way that the printer prints out the label. The drink that she gives me looks extremely watered down. I take one sip and it just tastes like water. My theory (because I didn't see what she did with my drink) is that she took my drink, dumped out the whole milk and then filled it with water. I was so disappointed. I just ended up leaving. Can't tell you how the Danish is as I still haven't eaten it yet. I feel like the concern for the wrong type of milk being put in wasn't taken very seriously and I wish that they would have just made things right by remaking the drink the right way. Now I am out $11 and wasted a 40 minute drive.
Comfortable, relaxing environment with a large drink menu.
Really welcoming environment and the drinks are always good. A nice place to study, read, or just hang out and relax for a bit.
Realmente hermoso, muchos ambientes, muy seguro, agradable si tienes mucho que hablar con amigas por ejemplo el lugar perfecto!!!

I use the one in Kannapolis.
It has a nice atmosphere.
I've sat a few times but mainly go.
Great place for coffee and relaxation.  Awesome service
Service was slow but they where busy and staff was friendly

First- time customer in drive thru. I ordered an iced latte with oat milk and 2 pumps of pumpkin pie syrup.  I got my order in a timely manner, however it did not taste good at all.  It tasted like watered down coffee with a splash of oat milk. Couldn't even taste the pumpkin.  When the lady handed me the cup, I asked her if it was the large because it looked way too small for a $9 drink. (Way more expensive than Starbucks). She said yes with an attitude and shut the window so fast I couldn't even finish confirming it was the right drink.  I didn't have time to go in and get it fixed.
The reason I felt the need to leave a review is because I usually love supporting Christian coffee shops but something was off.  I know people have bad days, but there was a bad vibe.
I did like all the decor!

Lots of interesting flavor options but they have the traditional vanilla latte too.  The staff was great and the environment was comfortable.  Plenty of parking and a drive thru too.  Along with all the standard coffee options (both hot and cold), they also offer a range of pastries as well - although we came later in the day so the selection wasn't quite as broad as earlier.  I'd recommend trying The Holy Grind Coffee House
I got the Conquest of Canaan. Best cup of coffee I've had. Will be back.
Amazing staff!! They are always in a happy mood! I love the back-ground music, and the "Jesus Loves You" written on the side of the cup! That always makes me smile! And the coffee is wonderful!

I love the Holy Grind. The shop itself is lovely and soothing with multiple areas to sit, to talk, and to just enjoy your coffee.  I have seen people in there meeting for Bible studies, people doing work, people chatting and some just reading.  The people behind the counter are always nice and they make some great drinks.  I personally love the frozen drinks like the Red Velvet and the Snickerdoodle drinks.  They have smoothies, little pastries, and speciality drinks for the season.  Great place and I highly recommend.

First time customer. I went through the drive thru for an iced coffee and when I asked what sugar free flavors are available, I was expecting to hear just a few. Instead, the very nice man rattled off a whole list of flavors and I can't tell you how surprised and excited I was. I went with the sugar free caramel and it did not disappoint. It was bliss! You'll be seeing me on a regular basis because I am now on a quest to try every flavor. I love this place!
Great place for coffee in the run or sit and relax. Great background music.
Service was great and she gave great recommendations for our drinks. We will be back

I had the sweetest Baristas today, Kennady and Carly were so kind and joyful, their spirit definitely put a smile on my face!  Thank you Holy Grind for bringing a place to Kannapolis that could be a light to this area!   It was much needed!  My white Roman was awesome too!! Great visit all around!!

I have been debating whether to leave a review or not, but I feel like the public needs to know what goes on at The Holy Grind. I worked there over a year. First off the pay is horrible and  the managers took away the barista's electronic tips. They claimed that they were being taxed twice.I know many ppl you work in the restaurant industry and  asked them about the double taxation on credit card tips. Every single one told me that, that wasn't true... if the baristas gave the managers an idea on how to do something better the managers would belittle their idea and act like that only their ideas were the only good ones. I personally had the managers steal a prize that I had won for selling the most gift cards at Christmas. They keep the pastries in a refrigerator that doesn't even work. There have been several times that the pastries have had mold on them bc they were not stored properly. Also our caramel, chocolate and white chocolate would be filled every night. They never let the bottles run completely out so we could wash the before refilling them. I got fussed at one time bc the caramel was spoiled and there was mild in the rim of the bottle so I dumped all the caramel out and then scrubbed the bottle with soap and scolding hot water. I got fussed at and was told I should have saved the spoiled caramel. We were always out of supplies bc the managers didn't know how to do their job properly. The manager accused one of my very best friends of stealing coffee beans bc she didn't stay on top of keeping the beans ordered!!I know this is supposed to be a Christian establishment but I can tell you this these managers didn't act Christ like at all. They were very two faced and just down right nasty, cruel and they take advantage of ppl especially young teenagers bc that's all that they can really get to work there

Just went inside the nice building and stood at the count for 5 minutes, listening to 2 employees talking in the back. No one came to take my order after coughing loudly, so i would be heard so with no help i left with nothing. Need a bell out front to ring for assistance or bell on the door to be heard or someone out front waiting for customers.  How easy would it be to get a bad guy behind the counter with no one watching the front.
Fantastic coffee shop with fantastic staff
Atmosphere is EVERYTHING!!!
Very slow. Coffee wasn't that good.

Cafe carmel blended was great with whipped cream. My wife had taste of eden (kind of apple pie flavor). It was good too but I liked mine better. ;) Service was fine. Nice atmosphere. Relaxing. Give it a try if you are in the area.
Excellent coffee and pastries...service was friendly and courteous!
I've been several times and only once had an issue with service. The other times, service was wonderful!

This is one of the best kept secrets in the Charlotte region. Just north of Concord in sleepy Kannapolis, this Christian based coffee shop is a laptop toting coffee drinker's dream. Huge windows, tons of comfy seating, tables, bar & stool seating, couches, bean bags, arm chairs, sit wherever it feels  right. The environment is laid back and family oriented. Work while your favorite Christian music plays in the background. Each cup has a handwritten phrase like Jesus Loves You on it. The Staff is warm, fast and fun to talk with. Do bring a sweater if you like to be warmer and maybe an extension cord. Food is pastries only - delish! You can bring your own too. Other than that, they have a drive thru window, lots of parking and the  restrooms are very clean.
Tabby was amazing. Great customer service, friendly and with a big smile.
Love the coffee and the people! Very nice place!
Very kind and helpful staff.  Was even willing to take a picture of our Bible study group
Comfy. Scrumdillyicious drinks. Loving the Lord, reminding us He loves us too.

We've always loved the location in China Grove but Kannapolis location does not know how to make good drinks. Love the Vibe and the setup but the coffee isn't good. The last two times the proportion of flavor-to-coffee is so bad. I ordered a frozen raspberry mocha, tasted like they forgot the coffee. It was like drinking raspberry flavored syrup with chocolate syrup on top. I offered it to my husband, he couldn't drink it. Offered it to my 12 yr old sister, she said it was nasty. It went in the trash. Waste of $
It's the people who make the difference.
Friendly staff, good snacks and tasty coffee. Stopped to meet some friends.
Even if our drink isn't perfect, the whole vibe/atmosphere of this place is so friendly and inviting, and the music they play is often so inspiring. It's why I love going there.

Best coffee shop I've ever visited!! The atmosphere was perfect for somewhere to get a cup of coffee with a sweet snack and have quiet conversation, study or just sit and relax. I ordered a Java Chip Frappuccino with a chocolate muffin and both were delicious and reasonably priced. My daughter tried the sweet tea and even that was delicious. Great customer service and very clean. Definitely recommend this place, I will be going back regularly!

Stopped by for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. I wasn't sure what to get and Carli hooked me up with the perfect cup of coffee. Best coffee I've had in a long time. If you're thinkin starbucks, try this place instead! Great prices, great service and excellent coffee. Thanks Carli! Will definitely make this a regular stop.
Amazing coffee and muffins however the reason I didn't give them a 5 star is because they do take a while to make your items service is slow

The coffee was COLD, was suppose to be hot. The service was HORRIBLE!!! I had a gift certificate and the young lady had no idea how to apply it. She also had no idea about what came in their drinks. She asked for assistance but the other young lady had no idea either. The coffee finally came and it was the worst cup of coffee I have had in a while. Their pastries came from Sam's Club, with a marked up price. I will NEVER RETURN and I love coffee. I say GO TO THE FRENCH EXPRESS less than 5 minutes down the street. They are much much better! Their coffee tastes much better.
We went later in the day so they were out of some things. The coffee is soo good and the employees are super nice.
Such a great place to sit & sip! Mom & I stopped in for a break here on our way home. We thoroughly enjoyed the drinks and the ambiance. We will come back. Really nice place!
Very nice atmosphere. Great place to meet/hangout, kickback and relax.
Very nice make the way I want it
Ok coffee with friendly staff and a nice atmosphere.  Open late as well which is super helpful.
Beautiful scenery excellent staff and the coffee is Amazing!!
Great coffee , but Not handicap excessable. They wanted me to come get my coffee and muffin. I am sorry I will not be going back.
Atmosphere was great. Drinks were prepared quickly and were correct temperature.

Very pretty, not super busy. One latte was as hot as lava the other was no hotter than breast milk. They called our 3 individual drinks out for us to pick up (not at the same time) but served other people at their table.
Peaceful place to chill with the family after work
This is an awesome place. Very friendly  I will be going back. It's one of my favorites
The drinks and food were pleasant, I love that they spread the love of Jesus.

Adorable! Excellent breve.
Lots of huge tables great for bible study or working remote
My friend and I each got the standard coffee flight. It was such a fun experience! The employees were incredibly kind and helpful!

Very nice and lovely workers. I finally tried this place. I got the orange creamsicle, it had absolutely no flavor to it. It was like eating ice that is orange the whip cream had way more flavor. That is the only thing I wasn't impressed with besides that definitely recommend this place!
Very well renovated, clean, well staffed with kind people. Love the ambiance and aesthetic. They play great music as well, and most importantly - the coffee was just right.
Holy Grind had 2 locations and I recommend both of them. Family friendly.

Beautiful cozy coffee shop! Love the aesthetics and ambience. Food drink and staff are all good! Must visit! If you are looking for a nice quiet place to rest, snack and relax, this is the place to be.
Excellent service and drinks

In town for a few weeks and Holy Grind Coffee House has proven to be a GREAT office on the road!  Great drinks, great staff and a great setting!  Not too loud and not too quiet. They regularly can be seen keeping everything clean, including the restrooms. Various styles of seating options are amazing!

I highly recommend this place for your coffee needs if you're ever in Kannapolis!

I went through the drive through with my dog and everyone was so friendly! Their cold brew was yummy and my dog loved her pup cup :) they wrote "Jesus loves you" on my drink which was warming to my heart. Great experience all around!
The coffee is delicious, the attention from the staff is kind and professional. Nice place
Really beautiful and warm place, good coffee and treats; the staff is nice; highly recommended!!!
Great coffee and customer service as always.  Glad they opened up a new location in Kannapolis!
